methods.name: starknet_traceTransaction
methods.summary: For a given executed transaction, return the trace of its execution, including internal calls
methods.description: Returns the execution trace of the transaction designated by the input hash

params.name: transaction_hash
params.summary: The hash of the transaction to trace

result.name: trace
result.description: The function call trace of the transaction designated by the given hash

methods.name: starknet_simulateTransactions
methods.summary: Simulate a given sequence of transactions on the requested state, and generate the execution traces. Note that some of the transactions may revert, in which case no error is thrown, but revert details can be seen on the returned trace object. . Note that some of the transactions may revert, this will be reflected by the revert_error property in the trace. Other types of failures (e.g. unexpected error or failure in the validation phase) will result in TRANSACTION_EXECUTION_ERROR.

params.name: block_id
params.description: The hash of the requested block, or number (height) of the requested block, or a block tag, for the block referencing the state or call the transaction on.

schema.description: a sequence of transactions to simulate, running each transaction on the state resulting from applying all the previous ones

params.name: simulation_flags
params.description: describes what parts of the transaction should be executed

result.name: simulated_transactions
result.description: The execution trace and consuemd resources of the required transactions

methods.name: starknet_traceBlockTransactions
methods.summary: Retrieve traces for all transactions in the given block
methods.description: Returns the execution traces of all transactions included in the given block

params.name: block_id
params.description: The hash of the requested block, or number (height) of the requested block, or a block tag

result.name: traces
result.description: The traces of all transactions in the block

items.description: A single pair of transaction hash and corresponding trace

oneOf.name: INVOKE_TXN_TRACE
oneOf.description: the execution trace of an invoke transaction

execute_invocation.description: the trace of the __execute__ call or constructor call, depending on the transaction type (none for declare transactions)

revert_reason.name: revert reason
revert_reason.description: the revert reason for the failed execution

state_diff.title: state_diff
state_diff.description: the state diffs induced by the transaction

execution_resources.title: Execution resources
execution_resources.description: the resources consumed by the transaction, includes both computation and data

oneOf.name: DECLARE_TXN_TRACE
oneOf.description: the execution trace of a declare transaction

state_diff.title: state_diff
state_diff.description: the state diffs induced by the transaction

execution_resources.title: Execution resources
execution_resources.description: the resources consumed by the transaction, includes both computation and data

oneOf.name: DEPLOY_ACCOUNT_TXN_TRACE
oneOf.description: the execution trace of a deploy account transaction

constructor_invocation.description: the trace of the __execute__ call or constructor call, depending on the transaction type (none for declare transactions)

state_diff.title: state_diff
state_diff.description: the state diffs induced by the transaction

execution_resources.title: Execution resources
execution_resources.description: the resources consumed by the transaction, includes both computation and data

oneOf.name: L1_HANDLER_TXN_TRACE
oneOf.description: the execution trace of an L1 handler transaction

function_invocation.description: the trace of the __execute__ call or constructor call, depending on the transaction type (none for declare transactions)

state_diff.title: state_diff
state_diff.description: the state diffs induced by the transaction

execution_resources.title: Execution resources
execution_resources.description: the resources consumed by the transaction, includes both computation and data

SIMULATION_FLAG.description: Flags that indicate how to simulate a given transaction. By default, the sequencer behavior is replicated locally (enough funds are expected to be in the account, and fee will be deducted from the balance before the simulation of the next transaction). To skip the fee charge, use the SKIP_FEE_CHARGE flag.

caller_address.title: Caller Address
caller_address.description: The address of the invoking contract. 0 for the root invocation

class_hash.title: Class hash
class_hash.description: The hash of the class being called

result.title: Invocation Result
result.description: The value returned from the function invocation

calls.title: Nested Calls
calls.description: The calls made by this invocation

events.title: Invocation Events
events.description: The events emitted in this invocation

messages.title: L1 Messages
messages.description: The messages sent by this invocation to L1

execution_resources.title: Computation resources
execution_resources.description: Resources consumed by the internal call. This is named execution_resources for legacy reasons

ORDERED_EVENT.title: orderedEvent
ORDERED_EVENT.description: an event alongside its order within the transaction

order.title: order
order.description: the order of the event within the transaction

ORDERED_MESSAGE.title: orderedMessage
ORDERED_MESSAGE.description: a message alongside its order within the transaction

order.title: order
order.description: the order of the message within the transaction

data.description: Extra information on why trace is not available. Either it wasn't executed yet (RECEIVED), or the transaction failed (REJECTED)
More data about the execution failure

transaction_index.title: Transaction index
transaction_index.description: The index of the first transaction failing in a sequence of given transactions

execution_error.title: revert error
execution_error.description: a string encoding the execution trace up to the point of failure
